intro: Sonneratia × paracaseolaris, commonly known as the mangrove hybrid, is a natural hybrid between Sonneratia caseolaris and Sonneratia alba. It is a shrub or small tree that thrives in brackish water environments, typically found in mangrove ecosystems. The plant has prop roots that help stabilize the soil and facilitate gas exchange in waterlogged conditions. Its leaves are alternate,革质 (leathery), and have a waxy surface to reduce water loss. It plays an important ecological role in coastal protection and provides habitat for various marine and terrestrial species.
